entry.title: Yellow Paper Daisy
entry.summary:
Author: Babysterek

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,114Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 35

Summary: “Well,” Peter says at last, forcing a crooked smile into his voice, “at least this time he didn’t almost get us all killed.”Derek swallows. His throat is dry, the words scraping on the way out. “I was drunk.” They land and disappear without effect. Talia turns then, her gaze settling on him fully. It’s steady, unreadable, and it makes his shoulders tense despite himself. “You were careless,” she says. Not angry. Not loud. Certain. “You are a werewolf, and if you got drunk, you laced it with wolfsbane, you did it. Do you understand, In twenty-four years, every scandal has had the same root. You. At some point, it stops being bad luck and becomes character. And I am tired of pretending this is something that merely happens to you.” Derek nods once, reflexive. “When you speak,” Talia continues, “you do so as a Hale. As Alpha blood. Your indulgences do not absolve you of that.” ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Derek just wanted a moment of quiet. Instead, he crosses a line with the last person he should trust.....old grudges, bad decisions, and a mistake he keeps repeating.

entry.title: Nothing Like Losing a Limb
entry.summary:
Author: ash_mcj

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 44,871Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 1,084

Summary: Once the smoke dissipated after the tragedy at Hale Manor, the survivors of the once-thriving pack were scattered like ash in the wind. For some, the next two years passed like a suffocating gust of wind, pinning them to the burning embers they could never quite heal from. For others, it dragged on slowly, allowing their scars to fade as they watched the grass on their scorched life regrow. Though, one thing was for certain: none of them came out of the flames unscathed.[or: derek self-destructs, allison finds strength and guidance in the side of her bloodline she’d never thought to explore, cora learns to survive in treacherous conditions, jackson attempts to function without his other half, and the stilinskis try so hard not to completely crumble that they inadvertently build themselves a new pack to protect the hale territory]

entry.title: Mates, Magic and Mischief
entry.summary:
Author: stereksterek

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,820Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 88

Summary: The Alpha looked confused and concerned all at the same time, so taking an educated guess, Stiles ventured a theory. “Oh great. Let me guess… We’re lost aren’t we?” Derek growled at the insult and continued to scan the trees, rocks and stumps around them. “We’re not lost, Stiles. The landscape has… changed.” “Changed?” Stiles repeated in disbelief, before intentionally wandering in front of the werewolf to block his view. “As in, the trees just grew legs and walked away?” ___ Or, 5 times magic messed with Derek and Stiles, and the 1 time it got it right...

entry.title: BLOODLINE PROTOCOL
entry.summary:
Author: knox_rivers

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 158,691Chapters: 46/?Kudos: 180

Summary: At Beacon Hills Preparatory, tradition is everything. For over a century, the elite boarding school has divided its student body into five historic houses where each one seemingly determined by a mix of academic performance, behavior, and an unspoken layer of socioeconomic legacy. Most students follow in the footsteps of their families; generation after generation they're sorted into the same houses. No one questions the system. It’s simply the way things are. Until now. Midway through his freshman year, a “routine” blood test for school health records takes an unexpected turn. One sharp-witted yet grounded Stiles, recently appointed as House Prefect of the mid-tier House Flagstaff largely due to his father’s position as the town sheriff, is abruptly reassigned to House Redwood, the school’s most elite and secretive house. He must now navigate secret traditions, political manipulation, and a slow-burning forbidden romance with someone he was never meant to meet: the enigmatic sophomore son of a ruthless defense attorney.

entry.title: Where Ashes Lie
entry.summary:
Author: TendreChaos

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,837Chapters: 13/40Kudos: 76

Summary: Stiles has always known he was different, that there was something inside him people were afraid of.In a society where the supernatural is hunted and contained, sorcerers are stripped of their names, their freedom, and their humanity. After months of captivity behind concrete walls, Stiles manages to escape and disappears into the woods, where he finds a rebel group willing to take him in. But trust is fragile and Stiles carries a secret, a power he barely understands and cannot share.Because if they knew the truth, if they knew what Stiles really was... They wouldn’t hate the cage that once held him.They’d build a stronger one.

entry.title: Survivors
entry.summary:
Author: Nenufarluz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 115,174Chapters: 41/?Kudos: 199

Summary: The world fell into ruin in just a few days, overtaken by a virus that turned ordinary people into ravenous undead. Amid the chaos, Stiles, a college student in New York, is forced to leave the safety of his dorm and try to make his way across the country. His destination: California, where he hopes to find his father and best friend still alive.The journey is brutal. Zombies aren’t the only danger, here’s hunger, cold, loneliness, and the cruelty of other survivors. Along the way, Stiles meets Derek Hale, a gruff and guarded man who is also searching for his family. Together, they form a strong alliance, fighting side by side through the devastation.As the world around them falls apart, the two discover something stronger than fear and loss: the growing connection between them. Amid the pain, the possibility of something unexpected begins to emerge... maybe even love.

entry.title: My Name is Derek Hale [comic]
entry.summary:
Author: Melioristicbeast

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 0Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 904

Summary: From the original fic this comic is an adaptation of:“What day is it?” Derek demanded. “What?” “The day! What day is today?!” Derek let Stiles go, but only so he could reach into his pocket and pull out his phone. He tapped at the home screen, and then went so perfectly still that Stiles was pretty sure this guy wasn’t human. No human could stand that still. When it was clear Derek wasn’t going to move again without some prompting, Stiles said, “It’s Wednesday.” “That’s impossible,” Derek whispered. “Not really, it comes around every seven days.” “This is impossible,” Derek said again, looking around himself, as if he was searching for something.

entry.title: Ravensholme
entry.summary:
Author: VermillionQ

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 336,556Chapters: 44/?Kudos: 207

Summary: The Verse, as it is known, exists in a state of anarchy, with hundreds of billions of worlds and species, where marvels of magic and technology abound, and more often than not, you are likely to live in poverty and fear. Thousands of factions vie for dominance, resources, power. Great empires that span hundred of systems are dwarfed by even greater corpocratic states who themselves are dwarfed by religious movements. In a small corner of the Milky Way, Claudia Stilinski set out to make her faction the greatest...and she did. When Claudia, the leader of Ravensholme, passes away unexpectedly it leaves her teenage son Stiles alone except for a father in Beacon Hills whom he has never truly known. Stiles is forced to remain on Earth as the Ravensholme Triumvirate seeks to keep the borders of their growing dominion safe from their rivals, while watching over their beloved leader's son until he comes of age. Stiles, filled with rage and despair at his mother's death, is forced to move to Beacon Hills, California, cut off from his friends, and heartsick. He is forced to reckon with his own trauma and contend with being a teenager and heir to what many call The Verse's one true hope to creating a better life for all.

entry.title: Full Moons and Family Drama
entry.summary:
Author: thenerdyindividual

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,792Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 277

Summary: Talia Hale survives the Hale Fire, along with Laura, Derek, Peter, and Cora. It's been roughly ten years since the events of that night, and to say that it left scars would be an understatement. Desperate to bring her Pack back to its old strength, Talia will not stop pushing her children and brother to settle down and have kids of their own. For this year's Cold Moon, Peter finally brings someone home. Stiles is not at all what Talia was expecting. He's far too young for Peter, he's human, and worst of all a man. (No biological children to carry on the Pack). He also doesn't give a shit what Talia says about him. His mere presence is enough to have her melting down, and it's bad for the simmering tension between her and the rest of the Pack. Unfortunately, everyone else likes him. Derek might like him more than the rest. A little too much. Aw hell, he has a crush on his uncle's boyfriend. Or: Five times Peter brought Stiles to a Full Moon Run + One time Derek did. (Updates every other Tuesday)

entry.title: A Borrowed Sky
entry.summary:
Author: 1223rhys

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 113,444Chapters: 21/23Kudos: 172

Summary: He thought he could outrun his past. After a shootout leaves his gang scattered and the law on his heels, Derek slips into another man’s life—marriage offer and all. But he didn’t expect Stiles: clever, stubborn, and heartbreakingly sincere. And when the past catches up, Derek will have to choose what kind of man he really is—the one he left behind, or the one he’s pretending to be. Marriage was part of the plan. Falling in love wasn’t.

entry.title: Let Me Lay Waste to Thee
entry.summary:
Author: extrasourwolf

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,689Chapters: 8/8Kudos: 90

Summary: The town of Beacon Hills generally avoids the old Hale Manor. It’s surrounded by a forest of tall trees, winds that can’t possibly be anything but supernatural, and a foreboding sense of doom. The townspeople like to tell their children stories about it, like to tell them that if they listen closely enough, they can hear the beast howling in the night, looking for prey.Stiles would like to inform them, however, that he’s probably just howling because Finstock decided that spicy soup was the way to go and spicy for Finstock is “ow-you-fucking-teapot-are-you-trying-to-kill-me?!” for normal people (or normal beasts– semantics, semantics).
